model

Class DatabaseUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.DatabaseUtility

  • public class DatabaseUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class for retrieving the persistent data of this application. Make sure to include an initialization call from ServletContextListener

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      Retrieves the number of people who have walked into the given gym today.

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxCount

        public static int getMaxCount(Gym gym)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieves the maximum number of people that have ever been in the gym at a given time.
        Parameters:
        gym - The gym to find the maximum count for.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of people that have ever been in the gym at the same time.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database was empty

      • getCountData

        public static java.util.List<CountDatapoint> getCountData(Gym gym,
                                                          DayOfWeek day)
        Retrieves the number of people who were in the given gym on the most recent completed given day.
        Parameters:
        gym - the gym.
        day - the most recent day that is completely over.
        Returns:
        a list of CountDatapoints representing a days worth of entries of the number of people in the gym at a given time.

      • getCurrentCount

        public static int getCurrentCount(Gym gym)
        Retrieves the most recent number of gym rats in the given gym.
        Parameters:
        gym - the gym to retrieve the current number of customers from.
        Returns:
        the number of people currently in gymName.

      • getGymClasses

        public static java.util.List<GymClass> getGymClasses(Gym gym,
                                                     DayOfWeek day)
        Retrieves a list of GymClass objects associated with gymName on dayOfWeek. This implementation reads in all GymClass data on server startup in order to decrease latency time for data retrieval.
        Parameters:
        gym - The gym to retrieve GymClasses from
        day - The day of the week to retrieve GymClasses for
        Returns:
        a list of all GymClass objects associated with gymName and dayOfWeek.

      • updateCurrentCount

        public static void updateCurrentCount(Gym gym,
                                      java.util.Date timestamp,
                                      int count,
                                      boolean in)
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Updates the current count of gymName with count and saves it in the database.
        Parameters:
        gym - The gym whose count will be updated.
        timestamp - The timestamp for the sensor that recorded the count.
        count - The number of people in the gym at time timestamp.
        in - true if newCount was recorded when someone was entering the gym and false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getAverageInCount

        public static int getAverageInCount(Gym gym,
                                    DayOfWeek day)
        Retrieves the average count of the number of people who came in to the given Gym for the given DayOfWeek.
        Parameters:
        gym - the gym
        day - the day
        Returns:
        the average number of people who entered the given Gym for the given DayOfWeek.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if an sql error occured

      • getInCountToday

        public static int getInCountToday(Gym gym)
        Retrieves the number of people who have walked into the given gym today.
        Parameters:
        gym - the gym
        Returns:
        the number of people who have walked into the given gym today.

      • init

        public static void init()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Initialize the class information and gym hours, etc. This loads all the class information into memory, at the start of the program, preventing additional disk reads which are slow and expensive.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException
